practitioner_domains.domain_description: Cancer treatment and management, focusing on all solid tumors with subspecialty interest in breast cancer
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Half of clinical time spent in actual cancer treatment, oncologist by training

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Clinic focused on opportunities to catch cancer early across all solid tumor types through blood work, imaging, physical assessments and surveys
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Half of clinical time spent in early detection, includes preventable cancers and early catchable diseases

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Genetic assessment and counseling related to cancer risk
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Third domain of expertise, chairs a high-risk breast cancer program

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of an individual's likelihood of developing breast cancer, including lifetime risk and interval risk calculations
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Uses genetic cancer risk assessment surveys, Tyrus calculator, Gail calculator, imaging, and family history

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Categorization of breast tissue density (A, B, C, D categories) affecting cancer detection and risk
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Automated software categorization from mammograms, influences supplemental imaging recommendations

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Inherited disease patterns including cancer in up to third degree relatives, used to generate pedigrees and assess genetic risk
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Comprehensive medical history taking, genetic risk assessment surveys

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Individual's diagnoses, medications, allergies, past surgeries, and previous medical events
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Comprehensive medical history during new patient consultations

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Number of births, hormonal exposures, miscarriages, abortions, previous breast biopsies
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Part of comprehensive assessment for breast cancer risk

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Smoking status, environmental exposures, employment, social support, marital status
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Risk factor assessment for cancer development

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Height and weight calculation used in risk assessment, though noted as inadequate measure
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Used in Tyrus risk calculation, modifiable risk factor

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of whether mammogram image captured all breast tissue with adequate positioning and quality
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Third-party software analysis of image acquisition quality

interventions.intervention_description: Whole breast ultrasound performed as supplemental screening for women with increased breast density (Category C or D) or intermediate breast cancer risk (Tyrer-Cuzick 15-20%)
interventions.purpose: To detect breast cancers that may be missed by mammography alone in dense breast tissue or intermediate risk patients

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Ultrasound provides better visualization through dense tissue than mammography

resource_requirements.equipment: Ultrasound machine with breast imaging capabilities
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Certified breast imaging technologist and radiologist

interventions.intervention_description: Bilateral breast MRI performed as supplemental screening for women with high breast cancer risk (Tyrer-Cuzick >20% lifetime risk)
interventions.purpose: Enhanced early detection screening for high-risk patients due to inadequacy of annual mammography alone

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: More frequent and sensitive imaging modality than standard screening

resource_requirements.equipment: MRI machine with breast imaging coils and contrast capability
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: MRI technologist and breast imaging radiologist

interventions.intervention_description: DNA testing via blood or saliva to identify hereditary cancer mutations when patient meets NCCN criteria
interventions.purpose: Identify inherited genetic mutations that significantly increase cancer risk for patient and family members

protocols.duration: Single sample collection, 2-3 weeks for results
protocols.frequency: One-time testing unless new indications arise
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Results-dependent, may require family cascade testing

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Genetic counselor assistance for pedigree development and result interpretation

resource_requirements.time: 30 minutes for collection, 60-90 minutes for counseling
resource_requirements.equipment: Blood collection supplies or saliva collection kit

interventions.intervention_description: Anti-estrogen medication for women with >1.66% 10-year breast cancer risk per Gail model to reduce cancer incidence
interventions.purpose: Reduce breast cancer risk by 50% in eligible high-risk women through estrogen blockade

interventions.intervention_name: Lifestyle Medicine Program - Body Mass Index Optimization
interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive nutrition and exercise program to reduce BMI and improve body composition as breast cancer risk reduction strategy
interventions.purpose: Modify controllable risk factors through BMI reduction and improved body composition to lower breast cancer risk

protocols.intensity: Individualized based on current fitness and health status
protocols.volume: Personalized caloric and macronutrient targets, structured exercise plan
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Monthly for first 3 months, then quarterly

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: One-size-fits-one personalized approach rather than standard protocols

resource_requirements.equipment: Body composition analysis, exercise equipment access
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Registered dietitian, exercise physiologist, lifestyle medicine physician

interventions.intervention_description: Educational intervention to reduce alcohol consumption as part of risky behavior modification for breast cancer risk reduction
interventions.purpose: Address alcohol as risk factor through education on metabolic impacts, BMI effects, and direct cancer risk associations

protocols.duration: Initial education session with ongoing support
protocols.frequency: Initial session, monthly check-ins for 6 months
protocols.volume: Educational materials, behavior tracking, support resources

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Individualized approach recognizing social connections while focusing on health benefits

resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Health educator, behavioral counselor, or lifestyle medicine specialist

interventions.intervention_description: Hyper-tailored imaging cadence based on individual risk factors including family history, breast density, and personal risk assessment
interventions.purpose: Optimize early detection through personalized screening intervals and modalities based on individual risk profile

protocols.frequency: Risk-stratified: 6-month intervals for high-risk, annual for intermediate, standard for average risk
protocols.intensity: Multi-modal imaging based on risk level
protocols.volume: Combination of 3D mammography, ultrasound, and MRI as indicated
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Annual risk reassessment with dynamic protocol adjustment

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Continuous risk monitoring and protocol adjustment based on changing factors

resource_requirements.time: Variable based on imaging modalities required
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Breast imaging radiologist, high-risk program coordinator

processed_files.file_name: Ontology Knowledge Gathering Interview - Mollie – 2025_07_24 17_13 BST – Notes by Gemini.txt

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Encompasses six areas: nutrition, physical activity, sleep, stress reduction/management, substance use reduction, and positive social connection to optimize health and functioning
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Uses lifestyle elements to prevent disease and treat existing conditions, working as foundation for optimal health span and lifespan

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Encompasses the spectrum of insulin resistance from normal glycemic control to impaired glucose tolerance, pre-diabetes, type 2 diabetes, and end-stage type 2 diabetes requiring exogenous insulin
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Also referred to as metabolic health domain

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Common conditions including hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes, overweight, and obesity
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Often overlaps with metabolic syndrome and related cardiovascular risk factors

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Management and prevention of chronic diseases in both hospital and outpatient settings using conventional western medicine
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Blends conventional approaches with lifestyle medicine using evidence-based protocols including medications, procedures, and surgeries as needed

practitioner_domains.domain_description: Assessment and management of cardiovascular disease and risk factors
practitioner_domains.specialization_notes: Often interconnected with metabolic health assessments due to metabolic syndrome overlap

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Blood test measuring average blood glucose over 3 months through red blood cell glycation
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Non-fasting blood test with reference ranges: <5.7 normal, 5.7-6.4 pre-diabetes, ≥6.5 type 2 diabetes

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Blood glucose measurement taken after fasting period
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Requires fasting collection, used alongside other glucose markers

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Insulin level measurement taken after fasting period
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Used in HOMA-IR calculation for insulin resistance assessment

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance calculation using fasting insulin and glucose
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Online calculator tool; <2 indicates no signs of insulin resistance

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Test measuring glucose and insulin response to 75g glucose load over 2 hours
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Gold standard for diagnosing insulin resistance; resource intensive requiring 3-hour lab visit

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Body Mass Index calculated from height and weight measurements
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Basic anthropometric measurement with demographic-specific reference ranges

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of body fat percentage and lean mass distribution
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Measured via DEXA scan (gold standard), waist circumference, or waist-to-hip ratio

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Measurement of waist at appropriate anatomical landmarks
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Requires proper instruction for accurate measurement; has gender and ethnicity-specific reference ranges

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Comprehensive assessment of weight trajectory, previous interventions, and relationship with weight
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Critical for interpreting body composition results; includes screening for eating disorders and medication effects

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of sleep duration, quality, regularity, and potential sleep disorders
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Uses questionnaires like GSAQ, Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, Stop-Bang for sleep apnea risk

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of risk factors and symptoms for obstructive sleep apnea
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Stop-Bang questionnaire used; higher risk with elevated BMI, hypertension, male gender

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Comprehensive evaluation of dietary patterns, preferences, and eating behaviors
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: 24-hour dietary recalls, food logging, dietary preferences assessment, eating pattern evaluation

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of exercise patterns including intensity, duration, and frequency
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Uses IPAQ questionnaire; benchmark of 150 min/week moderate or 75 min/week vigorous intensity plus 2 days strength training

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Assessment of stress as demands exceeding available resources to manage them
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Uses PSS-4 questionnaire; includes screening for mental health conditions like anxiety and depression

constructs_mentioned.construct_description: Patch-worn device measuring interstitial fluid glucose continuously for ~2 weeks
constructs_mentioned.assessment_context: Shows glucose response to meals, stress, sleep; requires interpretation by knowledgeable practitioner

interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive assessment combining conventional western medicine biomarkers with lifestyle medicine pillars to evaluate and manage blood glucose/metabolic health
interventions.purpose: To assess insulin resistance spectrum from normal glycemic control to type 2 diabetes and develop personalized lifestyle interventions

protocols.frequency: Initial assessment then regular follow-ups based on risk stratification
protocols.volume: Comprehensive multi-pillar assessment covering 6 lifestyle medicine domains
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Based on A1C trends and clinical progression

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Focus on weight, BMI, hemoglobin A1C, waist circumference, basic lifestyle questionnaire
Add fasting insulin, DEXA scan, detailed weight management history, structured lifestyle pillar interviews
Include oral glucose tolerance test, CGM monitoring, comprehensive sleep studies when indicated
Account for hemoglobinopathies, medication effects, chronic conditions affecting interpretation

resource_requirements.time: Variable - basic assessment 30-60 minutes, comprehensive assessment 2-3 hours across sessions
resource_requirements.equipment: Basic: scale, tape measure, blood draw supplies. Advanced: DEXA scanner, CGM devices, sleep study equipment
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Lifestyle medicine trained clinician with knowledge of metabolic health, sleep disorders, nutrition counseling
resource_requirements.cost_level: Low to High based on assessment depth and technology used

interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive dietary evaluation using 24-hour recalls, food logging, and CGM data to optimize blood glucose management
interventions.purpose: To assess current nutritional patterns and provide evidence-based dietary modifications for blood glucose control

protocols.duration: Initial assessment with ongoing monitoring and adjustments
protocols.frequency: Regular food logging with periodic reviews
protocols.intensity: Detailed 24-hour dietary recalls and pattern analysis
protocols.volume: Comprehensive dietary preference assessment, eating behavior evaluation
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Weekly to monthly based on CGM data and clinical response

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Use any available food logging method (Excel, Word, photos, apps)
Adapt to patient's preferred logging method and technology comfort level

resource_requirements.equipment: CGM devices (Stilo/Dexcom), food logging apps (Aura Stilo, Diet ID), basic measuring tools
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Nutrition counseling with blood glucose management expertise
resource_requirements.cost_level: Moderate to High with CGM integration

interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive sleep evaluation including sleep disorder screening and sleep hygiene optimization for metabolic health
interventions.purpose: To identify and address sleep disorders and poor sleep quality that impact blood glucose management

protocols.duration: Initial screening with ongoing monitoring and interventions as needed
protocols.frequency: Daily sleep tracking with periodic comprehensive assessments
protocols.intensity: Ranges from basic questionnaires to formal sleep studies
protocols.volume: Multi-tool assessment including GSAQ, Stop-Bang, PSQ, wearable data
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Monthly for sleep hygiene, as needed for sleep disorders

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Low threshold for sleep medicine referral and formal sleep studies
Focus on validated questionnaires and wearable data for initial assessment

resource_requirements.time: Initial assessment 30-45 minutes, sleep study referral coordination
resource_requirements.equipment: Wearable devices (Aura Ring), sleep study equipment when indicated, validated questionnaires
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Sleep disorder screening knowledge, sleep hygiene counseling
resource_requirements.cost_level: Low to High depending on need for formal sleep studies

interventions.intervention_description: Systematic evaluation of current activity levels and development of personalized exercise prescriptions based on Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans
interventions.purpose: To assess current physical activity levels and develop interventions to meet guidelines for metabolic health improvement

protocols.duration: Initial assessment with progressive activity prescription
protocols.frequency: Target 150 minutes moderate or 75 minutes vigorous weekly plus 2 days strength training
protocols.intensity: Light, moderate, vigorous based on individual capacity and perceived exertion
protocols.volume: Comprehensive activity assessment including steps, exercise minutes, strength training
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Monthly progress reviews with activity adjustments

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Individualized intensity assessment using talk test and RPE
Focus on daily physical activity and functional movement integration

resource_requirements.equipment: Wearable activity trackers, IPAQ questionnaire, basic fitness assessment tools
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Exercise prescription knowledge, understanding of activity guidelines

interventions.intervention_description: Comprehensive stress evaluation including mental health screening and stress management technique development
interventions.purpose: To identify stress levels and develop coping strategies that support metabolic health and blood glucose management

protocols.duration: Initial comprehensive assessment with ongoing stress management skill development
protocols.frequency: Regular stress monitoring with technique practice
protocols.intensity: Varies from basic stress awareness to intensive coping skill development
protocols.volume: Multi-domain assessment including demands vs resources evaluation
protocols.reassessment_intervals: Monthly stress assessment with technique refinement

constraints_accommodations.accommodation_strategy: Screen with GAD-7, PHQ-9 and refer for specialized mental health care when indicated
Careful screening with appropriate resources and referral support available

resource_requirements.time: Initial assessment 45-60 minutes, regular brief check-ins
resource_requirements.equipment: Validated questionnaires (PSS-4, GAD-7, PHQ-9), Aura Ring stress monitoring
resource_requirements.staff_expertise: Mental health screening competency, stress management counseling skills
